result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda Jean Reiter

records.addlTxt: Opt out letter

Defendant Amanda J. Reiter in court with attorney Amy Lynn Menzel.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   16CF151, 16CM88, 17CF29, 17CF231, 17CF247 called 10:10 am  Plea agreement stated on record by Atty Laufenberg.  16CF151 Plea to Ct 1 & 3, Ct 2 to be DRI.  16CM88 DRI   17CF29 Dismiss Ct 1 & 2 Plea to CT 3.  17CF231 DRI  17CF247 Plea to Ct 1 & 2.  State give sentence recommendations.  16CF151 & 17CF29 Ct 3 on both Sentence withheld probation 2 yr conditions.  16CF151 Ct 1 Impose 3 yr IC & 3 yr ES with 3 yrs probation.  17CF247 Ct 1 & 2 Sentence withheld probation 18 months.  17CF247  Court reviews right to preliminary hearing.   Waiver form reviewed with def.  Def waives right to preliminary.  Court accept waiver.  Court finds probable cause & bound over for filing of information for 16CF151 & 17CF247. Informations filed.  Waive reading.  Def will entered pleas to Cts 1 & 2 , Ct 3 & 4 to be DRI.   Plea agreement accepted by counsel & def.  Plea questionnaire form completed and reviewed on record.  16CF151 Ct 1 - No contest plea  Ct 3 - No contest   17CF29 Ct 3 - no contest   17CF247 Ct 1 no contest plea   Ct 2 - no contest plea.   Court will dismiss  and read in   16CF151 Ct 2 , 17CF29  Ct 1 & 2,  17CF231, 16CM88 ,  17CF247 Ct 3 & 4.  Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed.  Court finds pleas entered freely & voluntarily.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Factual basis for pleas.  Pleas accepted, found guilty  16CF151 Ct 1 & 3,  17CF29 CT 3, 17CF247 Ct 1 & 2.  Victim rights have been complied with.  State presents sentencing arguments.  Sentencing arguments presented by Atty Menzel.  Nothing by def.   Sentencing remarks by court.   Court will follow plea agreement in some ways.  16CF151 Ct 1 Sentence withheld 3 yr probation   Cost & DNA surcharge & sample.  AODA assessment if not completed and comply with treatment.  Absolute Sobriety  alcohol & controlled substances unless validly prescribed. Take  medications as prescribed    Maintain full time employmentl 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.   Counseling as deemed necessary.   100 hr community service.  Coooperate with Dept of SS with open chips cases  Ct 3  Sentence withheld,  2 yrs probation  Cost.  DNA surcharge waived.  Same conditions except for community  service    17CF29 Ct 3 Sentence withheld probation 1 yr   Cost & DNA surcharge.  Same conditions as ct 1 in 16CF151. 16CF151 - 1 day sentence credit if revoked    17CF29 1 day sentence credit if revoked.  17CF247 Ct 1 Sentence withheld 18 months probation.  Cost  same conditions.  Contact with children only as approved by Dept SS  Ct 2 - 3 yrs probation 6 yrs prison 3 yr IC & 3 yrs Es. stayed.   Cost & DNA surcharge.  1 day credit.  same conditons as in 16CF151  & in Ct 1    Def has posted $200.00 & $500.00  16CM88 bond, refund to poster.  New $500.00 bond, apply $200.00 to oldest file, $300.00 to poster, D.S.   Felony conviction  eligible for sub abuse & earned released.   Felony conviction rights reviewed.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.   Post conviction rights.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg, 17CF29 has victim, restitution $46.02.  Counsel reviews with def.  Restitution will be joint & several.  Def & counsel will agree to $46.02 restit.  Court will order 17CF29 rest. $46.02 joint & several.
Amended bail/bond (see 16-CF-151)

Defendant Amanda J. Reiter in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court recalls 16CF151, 17CF29, 17CF231, 17CF247 and 16CM88 @ 11:04 a.m. Def is now present, however Atty Menzel is not present. Court asks Def why didn't appear. Response by Defendant. Court asks State if recommendation was going to include any jail time. Response by State. Court advises Def of warrants authorized earlier and asks what State is asking at this time. Remarks by the State, asks for cash bond. Court asks for Def's work information and makes phone call to verify employment. Response by Defendant. State's response, requests $2,000 cash bond and that matter be rescheduled next week for plea/sentencing. Remarks by the Court. Court vacates warrants authorized. Amends bond to cover all cases to $700 cash. $200 already posted in 16CM88. Court will set for hearing to review bond and/or plea and sentencing.  Hearing scheduled for April 11, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Amy Lynn Menzel in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CF151, 17CF29, 17CF231, 17CF247 and 16CM88 @ 9:35 a.m. scheduled for 9:00 a.m. Atty Menzel doesn't know why Def hasn't appeared, makes statement about previous contact and asks to be able to reschedule if Def contacts her today. Response by State, asks for warrant. Does not object to the Court waiting until end of day to sign. Asks for warrant to be $2,000 or body, nationwide. State agrees to $500 or body on each. Atty Menzel confirms letter was sent to Def with correct date. Court authorizes warrants on each CF case body or $500, nationwide. On 16CM88 body or $500, statewide.

Defendant Amanda Jean Reiter in court with attorney Amy Lynn Menzel.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 17CF29, 16CF151 and 16CM88 @ 3:36 p.m. Def will waive prelimin hrg on 17CF29. Court reviews waiver w/Defendant. Off the record 3:38 Back on the record 3:39. Court continues review of waiver. Court finds waiver freely made. Court finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed electronically on 17CF29. State asks to file amended information on 16CF151. Court will allow. Def has ten days to file any motions regarding amended. Not guilty pleas to all cts in both cases. Court receives pleas and directs entry. Atty Menzel will file updated address for Def. All cases set for status conference.  Status conference scheduled for October 16, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

to withdraw (see 16-CF-151)

Court calls 16CF151, 16CM88 & 17CF29 @ 4:20 pm.  Defendant Amanda Jean Reiter in court with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Siehr only here on older cases.  Def. has copy of complaint in 17CF29.    Def. advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given options.  State gives bond recommendation. Court orders 1500 signature bond with no contact with Antigo Wal-Mart.  Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Amanda Jean Reiter in court with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 16CF151 & 16CM88.  Information filed and received.  Waive reading.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Bond will continue.  Both cases will called for status  Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Amanda Jean Reiter in court with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF151 & 16CM88  @ 2:21 p.m. Investigator Brett Foley, Langlade County Sheriff Dept, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Atty Siehr gives argument.  State gives argument.  Court finds probable & binds over for Information.  Atty Siehr request bond modification.  State objects.  Court will modifiy bond to $200 cash bond and $300 balance to be returned to poster in 16CM88.  Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Amanda Jean Reiter in court with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF151 & 16CM88  @ 1:44 pm.  Atty Siehr has copy of complaints, waives time limits for p.h. Def. waives time limits for p.h. 16CM88 Atty Siehr has copy of complaint, and enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives Not Guilty plea. State heard on bond in 16CF151.  Court orders $500 in 16CM88 to cover both files.  Condition to apply with family court.  Court not ordering.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Amanda Jean Reiter in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews court record.  Def has copy of complaint.  Warrant vacated.  Court reviews charge with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.  Def can contact public defender, hire an atty., or court appointed atty.    Defendant request public defender.    Def has posted $500. cash bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
